item.title: Big Pot Hole in entrance of access to garages, 29th January
item.description:
Pot Hole seems to be getting deeper, its been there since before christmas and worried its a sink hole, other cracks in the road near by can be seen, fear it could be a collapsed sewage
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Harrison Road, Shurdington, Tewkesbury

item.title: Ash Tree with some fallen limbs, 29th January
item.description:
I believe the trees which run alongside Birdlip Hill and the fields belonging to Marlborough House, are in the scope of Highways, as you pollarded a Sycamore close to the footpath within recent years. There would appear to be two ash trees which are in need of checking which run alongside Birdlip Hill. There have been some limbs fall into our field, but concerns are if they fall into the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ermin Way, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Ash Tree located on Highway land

item.title: Little Witcombe Court resident concern for falling tree on his home, 29th January
item.description:
It's on the verge off Green Lane just beyond my field. The neighbour approached me with concern about falling on his static caravan, given the high winds we have experienced. I stated I didn't think it was my tree but would investigate. I spoke with the Tree Officer at TBC and she suggested reporting it to you as likely Highways. I believe it's an Ash Tree but appears in good order from the untrained eye.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Swindon Lane over bridge by St Nicholas Church, 29th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Swindon Lane, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lightt at Pedestrian Crossing out, 29th January
item.description:
Looks like this has previously been reported but not acknowledged. It's the light right next to the pedestrian crossing and it makes it really dark at the crossing point and very difficult to see other path / road users or street furniture.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fiddlers Green Lane, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Phone box blocking pavement, 29th January
item.description:
The phone box has been knocked over and is causing a trip hazard and also looks unsightly. It has been this way for over a month. Please can it be either removed or put back into place. i believe the owner of the phone box is Community Heartbeat Trust
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Montpellier Street, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface
